message: Let's start with a fair split. I'll give you a decent amount to start, but be prepared to negotiate!
I think a 50/50 split is the fairest way to start. Let's see if we can work something out from here.
I'm not willing to give up 50% of the remaining money. I'll make a new offer that's a bit more aggressive.
I'm willing to compromise, but I think I deserve a bit more for my part in this negotiation. Meet me in the middle?
I'm willing to move closer to your offer, but I think a 45/55 split is a fair compromise. Let's try to reach an agreement before the value of our shares decreases further.
I'm not willing to accept a 45/55 split. I think I can do better than that.
I'm willing to take a bit more, but I think I deserve a bigger share. You're getting a good deal, so don't be shy!

I'm willing to increase my share, but I think a 40/60 split is the best we can do given the circumstances. Time is running out, and the value of the money keeps decreasing. Let's find a way to reach an agreement before it's too late.
I'm not willing to give up that much. I think I can do better than that. Let's keep negotiating!
I'm willing to take a risk and push for a bigger share. You're running out of time to make a better offer!

I'm willing to increase my share slightly, but I think a 35/65 split is the best we can do at this point. The money is losing value quickly, and we need to reach an agreement soon. Let's be reasonable and come to a deal before it's too late.

This is my final offer. Take it or leave it. I'm not willing to negotiate further.
I'm willing to go up to a 30/70 split. We're running out of time, and the value of the money is rapidly decreasing. Let's find a way to reach an agreement before it's too late for both of us.
I'm not willing to accept a 30/70 split. I think I've been too generous already. I'm going to make a final offer that I think is fair.
This is my final, final offer. Take it or leave it. I'm not budging any further.
